newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - Grain, soy basis hold steady.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - Grain, soy basis hold steady.

text.p: U.S. FOB Gulf corn, wheat and soybean basis values were holding steady on Tuesday in very quiet conditions, export sources said.

Export trade was slow although the Commodity Credit Corp of USDA said it bought 7,220 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 or better hard red winter wheat from Archer Daniels Midland Co for donation to Bosnia, May 7-31 shipment.
Taiwan Flour Millers Association was also holding a tender early Wednesday for 68,300 tonnes of U.S. wheat for April-June shipment.
CORN (No. 3 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
May +19 + K unc +22 + K unc
June +19 + N unc +22 + N unc
July +20 + N unc +23 + N unc
Aug 1-20 unq + U nc +34 + U unc
Aug 12-31 unq + U nc +33 + U unc
Note: K=CBOT May, N=CBOT July, U=CBOT Sept, nc=no comparison.
SOYBEANS (No. 2 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu)
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
FH May unq + K nc +26 + K unc
LH May unq + K nc +27 + K unc
June FH unq + N nc +26 + N unc
June LH unq + N nc +27 + N unc
July FH unq + N nc +28 + N unc
July LH unq + N nc +29 + N unc
Note K=CBOT May, N=CBOT July, nc=no comparison

-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
April unq nc +32 + K unc
May unq nc +28 + K unc
June unq nc +25 + N unc

HRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis KCBT, cts/bu) -
April unq nc +55 + K unc
FH May unq nc +50 + K unc
LH MAY unq nc +45 + K unc

Note: K=May futures, N=July futures.
((Chicago newsdesk 312-408-8720))
